Post-Match Reflections: Jonathan Kuminga suffered a significant right ankle sprain in the Warriors' win over the Grizzlies.
Kuminga left the arena on crutches.
Draymond Green expressed concern for Kuminga saying 'Sucks.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The injury interrupts another solid season from the 22-year-old Jonathan Kuminga.
Kuminga really seemed to be finding his footing over the last month.
One month remains until the NBA's Feb. 6 trade deadline.
The Warriors could look to be active again since they're eighth in the Western Conference and only 2.5 games ahead of the Sacramento Kings and Phoenix Suns in 11th and 12th respectively.
Others: Steve Kerr said Kuminga suffered a'significant' ankle sprain and will get an MRI.
Kyle Anderson will 'fill in well' during Kuminga's absence.
The injury could force the Warriors' general manager Mike Dunleavy Jr. to consolidate depth into frontcourt reinforcements.
